entry.content:
From this project, We wanna show the importance of protecting our environment through information visualization in 3 interactive installations.

Glacier is melting

The first one is an oil painting. At first, it shows antarctic glaciers and cute penguins. Then everyone can draw something on the painting by using blue. The oil paint is like sea-water,  it gradually submerges the land because of global warming. 

Disappearing island

The second one is the disappearing island. In the beginning, We put ice cubes on the pot and when ice cubes melted, the simulated sea-water will submerge the island. 

The future of humanity

The third one is letting people be under the projection and feel the sound and vision of sea-water.

The student I.D. card system is an important part of school management. Current student I.D. has more than 30 major functions, which covers all aspects of school life, but of course the student I.D. system is still in the process of continuous development. Most schools are still using a machine to achieve a lot of functions such as card recharging, paying air conditioning fee, paying Internet fee…

We found that the usability and ease of use of the machine in SCUT are pretty bad, so we are gonna try to improve the system through the usability test.

entry.title: You’re Chef
entry.summary: Website designed to make busy life easier and improve the life quality…
entry.content:
Website designed to make busy life easier and improve the life quality through food packages

Background

As a student, I’m often looking out for opportunities to gain some experience conceptualizing and designing applications end-to-end. When I was studying abroad in America, I found it’s really difficult to decide what to cook everyday. I usually spent 2 hours on preparing food and cooking, but it only takes me 5 minutes to eat. After that, I have to do the dishes. I love cooking, because it’s healthy and cheap. However, I just feel too tired to cook after studying at most time. I feel like it’s a common problem for all the young people.

I attempted to design a solution that would help customers have fun in the kitchen and learn to cook delicious meals. I framed out design challenge as follows:

How might we solve the problem that people always don’t know what to eat everyday?

Exploratory Research

Competitive Analysis

I found that surprisingly there is no food box subscription service in China. So I analysed several famous food box subscription websites in America. there are a lot of different kinds of food boxes, such as grocery box(ingredients), pre-made food box, baking box, snack box and so on.

The good thing is that they are convenient and healthy. They want their customers to enjoy food. They also have special menu considered for vegetarian and people who want to keep fit. Mostly customers can choose what they want, but those choices are limited. It seems most food boxes are designed for two people or more, but actually people who live alone also need such service. The reason is they can’t buy a lot of food at one time and usually it’s kind difficult to cook the right amount for one person.

entry.title: Voibook Training App
entry.summary: Listening and Speaking training APP for hearing-loss people. I am a hearing-loss…
entry.content:
Listening and Speaking training APP for hearing-loss people. 

Background

I am a hearing-loss person with a cochlear implant. Now I need to practice listening and speaking skills. I have found some software by myself, including Angel Sound,Mandarin Learning and even Chinese proficiency test Apps. Most Mandarin learning apps assume that users can understand Mandarin directly and easily, also the hearing-loss are not their target users.

From a hearing-loss user

There are 3.6 billion hearing-loss people around the world,nearly 90 million in China. The hearing-loss account for more than 30% of the number of disabled people in China. It’s a huge group of people.

Hearing-loss are people whose hearing is partially or completely lost. Hearing-loss people are easily get into troubles in their lives because of the adverse effects of hearing on them. So they can’t get into mainstream society very well. In fact, people with hearing impairment have the same vocal organs as normal people. Therefore, as long as they get suitable training, the hearing-loss people can possibly speak in the future.

We attempted to design a solution that would help hearing-loss people do listening and speaking rehabilitation. We framed out design challenge as follows:

How might we help hearing-loss people do listening and speaking rehabilitation through APP?

We followed a process with 3 phases of research: exploratory, generative, and evaluative. As a result, we were able to experiment with a variety of research methods, which led to some valuable insights and concept directions.

Exploratory Research

Literature Review

I began by reading a lot of thesis about characteristics, language recognition and rehabilitation of the hearing-loss. Through this research I discovered some initial insights that guided us moving forward:

  • Although people with hearing impairment can gain certain phonological awareness through lip reading, language training and hearing aids, their voice ability is still much lower than normal people.
  • Listening and Speaking are both important for language rehabilitation.
  • Hearing-loss people are better at using visual and kinesthetic cognition.
Competitive Analysis

Most of the current foreign apps are developed by speech therapy companies, and many applications are designed for speech language therapists. Foreign apps will classify vowels, consonants, and consonant clusters. their target is clear, and most of them have different difficult degree. In addition, there are also APPs dedicated to a certain consonant. Most domestic apps are designed for children to learn pinyin. There are no apps for both hearing and speech rehabilitation.

I also learned some devices for speech rehabilitation, such as Changzhou Qianxi, Shanghai Taiyige and COGNI. Those devices are expensive and mostly designed for school, hospital and language rehabilitation institution. I tried COGNI, actually the design and content are simple. Many features can be fully applied in apps.

Previous design

Those are pinyin training I did in voibook company before.

Survey

In order to understand who are our targeted users, what’s user requirement and how to fulfill their requirements, I conducted a survey and 135 results were collected. The following picture is part of the questionnarie.

 

User Interview

To understand the problem scope and the exercises experience from both sides, I conducted interviews with 5 hearing-loss people and concluded several points.

  • In general, they need hearing persons' help to correct their pronunciation
  • Users have a greater need for voice correction
  • They hope the App can tell them how to improve their pronunciation
Persona

Genertive Research

After our exploratory research, we began generative research with the goal of sparking ideas that can overcome the difficulties. We generated the following insights:

Solution
Structure

Evaluative Research

With our concept direction set, I began creating wireframes. I developed various iterations of the key features and began gathering feedback from our expert and development teams.

Wireframing

I received vital feedback from our team that we then integrated into our final designs.

  • If it is just a large number of cards sliding, it is difficult for users to locate the content they want to practice, which is less efficient.
  • In the listening part, the user wants to return to the original question page to listen the difference after they did multiple choice questions.
  • Users want to see their progress when they did training. 

Voibook Training App

The result of all this research and iteration is the Listening and Speaking training APP for hearing-loss people. Voibook training App is in order to help hearing-loss people to do basic language rehabilitation and live a normal life.

An App to help couples maintain their long distance relationship through artificial intelligence.

Background

I was very happy talking on the phone one second before, but when I hang up the phone, my tears ran down my cheek.

From a girl in long distance relationship

Nowadays, more and more couples have to leave each other and live in two different cities because of various reasons such as studying or working. Therefore, long distance relationships can cause a lot of trouble. We want to design an App to help couples maintain their long distance relationship somehow. entry.title: Cloud Shopping Cart
entry.summary: A function that can improve the user experience of people who have…
entry.content:
Background

As a college student, I almost buy all the things online. And when I mentioned what I bought  with my roommates or when my roommates see things I bought, they would ask me for the link. Since we always shop in the same store online, I found it’s tiresome to wait for my roommates to choose and it’s complicated to split the money, especially there is a coupon. Also, it’s easy to forget to pay back to the person who paid all the stuff.

So I want to design a function module of an APP to solve the problem and improve the user experience of people who have roommates and like to shop together online. I framed out design challenge as follows:

How might we help roommates shop online together and split the bill easily?

Exploratory Research

User Journey Map

I mapped out a user journey of a typical buy-things-together process to visualize areas where pain-points might arise.

   

User Interview

To understand the problem scope and the dining experience from both sides, I conducted 5 interviews with 4 students and 1 work starter.

  • Shopping togethter mostly happened during big sales
  • Users usually spent a lot of time on waiting their friends to decide what to buy
  • Girls like to discuss about goods and share to each other
  • It’s complicated to calculate（eg：$20 off $75 purchase）
Competitive Analysis

I observed several money split apps that help users to calculate money and split bill. Also,I found out some similar functions from Uber, Meituan and Airbnb.
